intro: Malabaila tempskyana, commonly known as the Malabaila tree, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its evergreen foliage and produces small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and trees known for their medicinal properties. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing benefits. The tree typically grows in tropical and subtropical climates, thriving in humid, well-drained soils.
